meanings.definition: Obtundities (noun): the state or quality of being obtuse or dull
meanings.sent1: His obtundities in class made it hard for him to understand the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The obtundities of the old pencil made it difficult to write smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The obtundities of the sleepy cat made it fall asleep during the day.
meanings.sent4: The obtundities of the fog blurred the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The obtundities of the blunt knife made it impossible to cut the vegetables.

meanings.definition: Obtundities (verb): to make dull or blunt
meanings.sent1: She tried to obtundities the sharp edges of the table to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent2: The constant use of the hammer obtundities its tip over time.
meanings.sent3: He obtundities the conversation by talking about the weather for hours.
meanings.sent4: The rain obtundities the colors of the painting on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous sound obtundities the listener's interest in the music.
